title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 35.7 - Uninsured operation in another state
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 35.7 - Uninsured operation in another state

State Regulations

Upon the receipt of evidence that a New York State resident
has operated an uninsured vehicle in another state, the registration and/or
driver's license or driving privilege of the registrant and/or operator
(driver) shall be suspended, as applicable until there is compliance with the
financial responsibility laws of such other state. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
35.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
